intro: Apterantha oligomeroides, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. The plant has a bulbous root system that allows it to store water and nutrients, enabling it to survive in harsh, dry conditions. Apterantha oligomeroides plays an important ecological role by providing nectar to pollinators such as bees and moths.
